skill.name: finishing-a-development-branch
skill.description: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the work - guides completion of development work by presenting structured options for merge, PR, or cleanup
skill.summary: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the wor...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. All static findings are false positives: hash strings (lines 11-12 skill-report.json) triggered C2/weak crypto pattern matches; git commands (SKILL.md) triggered shell execution patterns but these are standard version control operations presented for user execution, not auto-executed. The skill has no network calls, no direct file access, and includes safety mechanisms requiring explicit confirmation for destructive actions.

content.value_statement: After implementing a feature, deciding how to integrate the work can be unclear. This skill provides a structured process to verify tests, present clear options for merge or PR, and safely execute the chosen workflow with confirmation prompts.
actual_capabilities: Verify tests pass before presenting integration options
Determine the base branch from which the feature branch split
Present 4 structured options: merge locally, create PR, keep branch, or discard
Execute chosen workflow with appropriate git commands
Clean up worktree after merge or discard operations
Require explicit confirmation before destructive actions
limitations: Requires existing test infrastructure to verify tests pass
Cannot directly execute git commands - presents commands for user execution
Does not resolve merge conflicts automatically
Assumes standard feature branch workflow with main or master as base

use_cases.title: Learn safe branch completion
use_cases.description: Follow structured prompts to safely complete feature branches without accidentally losing work

use_cases.title: Automate branch cleanup
use_cases.description: Streamline the process of merging features and cleaning up worktrees after completion

use_cases.title: Guide AI assistants
use_cases.description: Provide AI tools with safe, verified workflows for completing development work

prompt_templates.title: Start branch completion
prompt_templates.prompt: I have completed my feature implementation. Guide me through finishing this development branch using the finishing-a-development-branch skill.

prompt_templates.title: After all tasks complete
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks in the plan are complete. Verify tests pass and present me with options for integrating this work.

prompt_templates.title: Merge locally
prompt_templates.scenario: Choose to merge to base branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Option 1 - merge locally to the base branch. Show me the commands and help me execute them safely.

prompt_templates.title: Create pull request
prompt_templates.scenario: Want to push and create PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Option 2 - push this branch and create a pull request. Help me generate a good PR description.

output_examples.input: I finished implementing the user authentication feature. All tests pass. What should I do next?
output: What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request
3. Keep the branch as-is (I'll handle it later)

output_examples.input: All tasks in the plan are complete and tests pass
output: 2. Push and create a Pull Request
Type the number of your choice:

best_practices: Always verify tests pass before offering integration options to prevent merging broken code
Present exactly 4 structured options without additional explanation to avoid ambiguity
Require explicit typed confirmation before executing destructive actions like discarding work
anti_patterns: Skipping test verification and proceeding directly to merge or PR creation
Asking open-ended questions like 'What should I do next?' instead of presenting structured options
Automatically cleaning up worktrees without checking if they should be preserved

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured prompts that any LLM can follow.

faq.question: What git commands does this skill execute?
faq.answer: The skill presents git commands for the user to execute. Commands include checkout, pull, merge, push, branch deletion, and worktree removal.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with other workflows?
faq.answer: It pairs with subagent-driven-development and using-git-worktrees skills. It is called after all implementation tasks complete.

faq.question: Is my work safe from accidental deletion?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill requires explicit typed confirmation before discarding work and never force-pushes without explicit request.

faq.question: What if tests fail when using this skill?
faq.answer: The skill stops and reports failing tests. It does not proceed with merge or PR options until all tests pass.

faq.question: How is this different from manual git workflows?
faq.answer: This skill enforces safety checks and provides a consistent structure. It ensures tests are verified and confirms destructive actions.
